For this role, he received critical acclaim and a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actor.

While in Arles, van Gogh's mental health began to deteriorate, culminating in his infamous self-mutilation and subsequent hospitalization.

His early life was spent in Huntington and later, he attended the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where he was a part of the NCAA Division I Men's Basketball team.

Jordan began his acting career in 2005, after moving to Los Angeles to pursue his passion for acting. In 2013, he gained recognition for his powerful portrayal of Oscar Grant, the unarmed African-American man who was fatally shot by a BART train officer in the film "Fruitvale Station," a role for which he received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor.

In 2015, Jordan starred as Apollo Creed's son in the critically acclaimed "Creed," a spin-off of the "Rocky" film series. The film was a huge success and established Jordan as a sought-after actor in Hollywood. In 2017, Jordan was cast as T'Challa's (Black Panther) cousin, N'Jadaka, also known as Erik "Killmonger," in Marvel's blockbuster film, which further cemented his place in the industry.

Aside from acting, Jordan has also been involved in producing. In 2017, he founded Outlier Society Productions, a film and television production company focused on creating stories that matter, with a commitment to diversity and inclusivity.

In addition to his acting and producing career, Jordan is known for his philanthropic work. He supports various causes, including cancer research, civil rights, and youth empowerment, and has been an advocate for environmental conservation and preservation.

Through his remarkable acting talent and his dedication to making a positive impact in the world, Michael B. Jordan has emerged as one of Hollywood's most respected and influential actors, and continues to work on inspiring and engaging stories.

**Early life**

Michael B. Jordan was born on February 13, 1987, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States. He grew up in the Logan Square neighborhood of the city, where his father worked as a truck driver, and his mother was a nurse.
